com.vector.cfg.consistency.groovy.api

Interface ISolver


  • @PublishedApi(value=ADDITIONS_ALLOWED)
 @PublishedApiDomain(value=AUTOMATION_IF)
 @ThreadSafe
public interface ISolver
    This interface is used to solve multiple results within one transaction.
    Solving validation-results with solving-actions always creates a transaction implicitly. An IllegalStateException will be thrown if this is done within an explicitly opened transaction.

    (c) Copyright Vctr Informatik GmbH. All Rights Reserved.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ISolvingActionSummaryResult solve(groovy.lang.Closure<?> clientBuilderConfigurer)
      solve(Closure) allows to solve multiple validation-results within one transaction.
      You should always use this method to solve multiple validation-results at once instead of calling ISolvingActionUI.solve() in a loop.
      ISolvingActionSummaryResult solve(java.util.function.Consumer<IResultFilterSolvingActionMapperBuilder> clientBuilderConfigurer)
      solve(Consumer) allows to solve multiple validation results within one transaction.
      This is the java pendant to solve(Closure).
      ISolvingActionSummaryResult solveAllWithPreferredSolvingAction()
      solveAllWithPreferredSolvingAction() solves all validation-results with its preferred solving- action (IValidationResultUI.getPreferredSolvingAction()).
      ISolvingActionSummaryResult solveSolvingActions(ISolvingActionUI... solvingActions)
      Solve with the passed solving actions in one transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • solve

        @PublishedMethod
ISolvingActionSummaryResult solve(@VDelegatesToWithClosureParam(value=IResultFilterSolvingActionMapperBuilder.class)
                                                    groovy.lang.Closure<?> clientBuilderConfigurer)
        solve(Closure) allows to solve multiple validation-results within one transaction.
        You should always use this method to solve multiple validation-results at once instead of calling ISolvingActionUI.solve() in a loop. This is very important, because solving one validation-result, may cause invalidation of another one. And calling ISolvingActionUI.solve() of an invalidated validation-result throws an IllegalStateException. Also, invalidated validation-results may get recalculated and you would miss the recalculated validation-results with the loop approach. But with solve(Closure) you can solve invalidated->recalculated results as well as results which didn't exist at the time of the call (but have been caused by solving some other validation-result).

        solve(Closure) waits for background-validation-idle in order to have reproducible results.

         
    validation{
        assert validationResults.size() == 4

        solver.solve{
           result{isId("Tp", 12)}
                .withAction{containsString("next bigger valid value")}
            // Call result() and pass a closure that works as filter based on methods of IValidationResultUI.
            // On the returned call withAction() and pass a closure that selects a solving-action based on methods of IValidationResultForSolvingActionSelect

            // multiple such calls can be placed in one solve() call.
            result{isId("Com", 34)}.withAction{containsString("recalculate")}
        }

        assert validationResults.size() == 1
        // Three Tp12 and zero Com34 (didn't exist) results solved. One other left
    }
        solve(Closure) returns an ISolvingActionSummaryResult.
        Parameters:
        client - a closure that configures the IResultFilterSolvingActionMapperBuilder
        Returns:
        the ISolvingActionSummaryResult
        Throws:
        SolverException - in the case of an error.

      • solve

        @PublishedMethod
ISolvingActionSummaryResult solve(java.util.function.Consumer<IResultFilterSolvingActionMapperBuilder> clientBuilderConfigurer)
        solve(Consumer) allows to solve multiple validation results within one transaction.
        This is the java pendant to solve(Closure).
        Parameters:
        clientBuilderConfigurer - a consumer that configures the received IResultFilterSolvingActionMapperBuilder
        Returns:
        the ISolvingActionSummaryResult
        Throws:
        SolverException - in the case of an error.

      • solveAllWithPreferredSolvingAction

        @PublishedMethod
ISolvingActionSummaryResult solveAllWithPreferredSolvingAction()
        solveAllWithPreferredSolvingAction() solves all validation-results with its preferred solving- action (IValidationResultUI.getPreferredSolvingAction()). Validation-results without a preferred solving-action are skipped. This method first waits for background-validation-idle in order to have reproducible results.
        Returns:
        the ISolvingActionSummaryResult

      • solveSolvingActions

        @PublishedMethod
ISolvingActionSummaryResult solveSolvingActions(ISolvingActionUI... solvingActions)
        Solve with the passed solving actions in one transaction.

        Please read the important note about invalidation in ISolvingActionUI.solve()

        Parameters:
        solvingActions - the solving-actions
        Returns:
        the ISolvingActionSummaryResult
